message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Valganciclovir is an antiviral medication used to treat viral infections, including cytomegalovirus. The medication can cause bone marrow suppression, leading to decreased production of blood cells, potentially resulting in pancytopenia. Hyperglycemia, abnormal dreams, and hepatic steatosis are not commonly associated with valganciclovir use.

Abnormal dreams and hepatic steatosis are rare adverse effects of valganciclovir.
